DataElement.preferredName: Quality of Life Urinary Symptom Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to represent the subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life in the presence of urinary symptoms.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Quality of Life Urinary Symptom Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.  The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness._Urinary; of or relating to urine, of or relating to the urinary system, or of or relating to the function or production or secretion of urine._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.  The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.

Concepts.definition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with urine or the organs of the body that produce and get rid of urine.:An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Urinary; of or relating to urine, of or relating to the urinary system, or of or relating to the function or production or secretion of urine.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

ValueDomain.preferredName: Urinary Symptom Quality of Life Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Urinary; of or relating to urine, of or relating to the urinary system, or of or relating to the function or production or secretion of urine._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.  The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is or has been unhappy.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is or has been unhappy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is or has been mostly dissatisfied.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is or has been mostly dissatisfied.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is or has been mostly satisfied.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is or has been mostly satisfied.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

ReferenceDocuments.name: If you were to spend the rest
ReferenceDocuments.description: If you were to spend the rest of your life with your urinary condition just the way it is no, how would you feel about it?

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated for NCI CCR trial. The AUA Symptom Score is a measure of the American Urological Association.
